title: Q5 - What is the governmentâ€™s role in regulating cross-border transfers?
description: Under the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 (DPDPA), the Central Government plays the primary and exclusive role in regulating cross-border transfers of personal data. While companies (Data Fiduciaries) may freely transfer personal data outside India, the Government can restrict or prohibit such transfers to specific countries or territories if it considers doing so necessary for reasons of sovereignty, integrity, security, or public interest.
